duties_responsibilities.duty: Research, plan, develop, and design electrical controls and electromechanical systems for automation of manufacturing processes.
Provide design support for automation design, safety, operational sequence, integration of subsystems, and overall operator controls.
Oversee electrical designs and controls provided by external sources, ensuring all standards and expectations are met.
Support enhanced design or modifications to electrical and control systems to support improvements in processes, enhanced OEE, or in support of NPD (New Product Development) requirements.
Support manufacturing processes by assisting in troubleshooting electrical systems or programming to get systems back to operation in a timely manner.
Update all documentation associated with engineering changes to existing systems, as well as develop documentation to support newly designed electrical systems.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or electrical technologies preferred. (Master’s preferred)
